headline: Franklin Resources, Inc. Announces Preliminary Month-End Assets Under Management
summary: SAN MATEO, Calif., October 03, 2025--Franklin Resources, Inc. (Franklin Templeton) (NYSE: BEN) today reported preliminary month-end assets under management (AUM) of $1.66 trillion at September 30, 2025, compared to $1.64 trillion at August 31, 2025. This month’s preliminary AUM reflected the impact of positive markets, partially offset by preliminary long-term net outflows of $11 billion, inclusive of $13 billion of long-term net outflows at Western Asset Management.1 Excluding Western Asset Man

headline: Franklin Templeton Completes Acquisition of Apera Asset Management
summary: SAN MATEO, Calif., October 03, 2025--Franklin Resources, Inc. [NYSE:BEN], a global investment management organization operating as Franklin Templeton, today announced the completion of its acquisition of Apera Asset Management ("Apera"). Apera is a pan-European private credit firm with over €5 billion in assets under management ("AUM") as of September 30, 2025, providing senior secured private capital solutions to private equity-backed companies in Western Europe.

content.title: Franklin Templeton Completes Acquisition of Apera Asset Management
content.summary: SAN MATEO, Calif., October 03, 2025--Franklin Resources, Inc. [NYSE:BEN], a global investment management organization operating as Franklin Templeton, today announced the completion of its acquisition of Apera Asset Management ("Apera"). Apera is a pan-European private credit firm with over €5 billion in assets under management ("AUM") as of September 30, 2025, providing senior secured private capital solutions to private equity-backed companies in Western Europe.

headline: Franklin Resources Shares Jump 24% in Past Year Amid Ongoing Valuation Debate
summary: If you own Franklin Resources stock or are thinking about making it part of your portfolio, you are not alone. The company has seen a rollercoaster of price movements lately, sparking plenty of conversation among investors. Over the past week, the stock dipped by 2.1%, and it has faced a steeper slide of 9.9% over the past 30 days. Yet, when you zoom out and look at the bigger picture, things appear more optimistic. Franklin Resources has gained 13.8% year to date and an impressive 24.3%...

headline: Their Funds May Not Beat the Market. Their Stocks Just Might.
summary: While the  has more than doubled over the past five years, T. Rowe’s stock has barely budged.  T. Rowe isn’t the only fund company struggling to keep up in recent years.  Going back a decade, the only major fund company to beat the S&P 500 is  BlackRock  edging out the market by a percentage point on an annualized basis.
